sen.j: 上杉朝宗（うえすぎ ともむね、1334年（建武 (日本)元年）? - 1414年10月8日（応永21年8月25日 (旧暦)））は南北朝時代 (日本)から室町時代前期にかけての武将。
sen.e: Tomomune UESUGI (1334 - 1414 October 8) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.
Tomomune UESUGI (1334 - October 8, 1414) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.
Tomomune UESUGI (1334 - October 8, 1414) was a busho (Japanese military commander) from the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) to the early Muromachi period.

sen.j: 上杉憲藤の子。
sen.e: Son of Norifuji UESUGI.
Son of Norifuji UESUGI.
Son of Norifuji UESUGI.

sen.j: 上杉禅秀（禅秀）、上杉氏顕、上杉氏朝（四条上杉家）の父。
sen.e: Father of Zenshu UESUGI,
Father of Zenshu UESUGI, Ujiaki Uesugi and Ujitomo Uesugi (Shijo-Uesugi family).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れ（訳が中断している）。訳を追記。
sen.e: Father of Zenshu UESUGI, Ujiaki Uesugi and Ujitomo Uesugi (Shijo-Uesugi family).

sen.j: 官位は修理亮。
sen.e: Official court rank is Shuri no suke (assistant officer of the Office of Palace Repairs).
His official court rank was Shuri no suke (assistant officer of the Office of Palace Repairs).
His official court rank was Shuri no suke (assistant officer of the Office of Palace Repairs).

sen.j: 中務大輔。
sen.e: Nakatsukasa no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs)
Nakatsukasa no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs)
Nakatsukasa no taifu (Senior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs)

sen.j: 禅助。
sen.e: Zenjo.
Zenjo.
Zenjo.

sen.j: 犬懸上杉家（又は四条上杉家）出身。
sen.e: He is from Inukake-Uesugi family (or Shijo-Uekake family).
He was from Inukake-Uesugi family (or Shijo-Uesugi family).
sen.cmt: is をwasに変更、Shijo-UekakeをShijo-Uesugi に修正
sen.e: He was from Inukake-Uesugi family (or Shijo-Uesugi family).

sen.j: 幼名は幸若丸。
sen.e: Childhood name is Kowaka-maru.
His childhood name was Kowaka-maru.
His childhood name was Kowaka-maru.

sen.j: 1338年、父が戦死したときは幼少であったため、兄の上杉朝房と共に家臣の石川覚道に養育された。
sen.e: When his father died in 1338, he was still in his childhood, so he was raised by the vassal, Kakudo ISHIKAWA, together with his older brother, Tomofusa UESUGI.
When his father died in 1338, he was still in his childhood, so he was raised by the vassal, Kakudo ISHIKAWA, together with his older brother, Tomofusa UESUGI.
When his father died in 1338, he was still in his childhood, so he was raised by the vassal, Kakudo ISHIKAWA, together with his older brother, Tomofusa UESUGI.

sen.j: 1365年から1376年まで上総国の守護に補任され、1377年に兄から家督を譲られて犬懸上杉家の当主となった。
sen.e: From 1365 to 1376, he was appointed as shugo (constable) of Kazusa Province, and in 1377, he received a family estate from his brother and became a family head of Inukake-Uesugi family.
From 1365 to 1376, he was appointed as shugo (constable) of Kazusa Province, and in 1377, he received the family estate from his brother and became the family head of Inukake-Uesugi family.
sen.cmt: family estateおよびfamily headの冠詞を共にa からtheに変更
sen.e: From 1365 to 1376, he was appointed as shugo (constable) of Kazusa Province, and in 1377, he received the family estate from his brother and became the family head of Inukake-Uesugi family.

sen.j: 1395年3月には関東管領に就任する。
sen.e: He is assigned to be a Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) in 1395, March.
He was assigned to be a Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) in March, 1395.
sen.cmt: is をwasに変更、in 1395, March を in March, 1395 に変更
sen.e: He was assigned to be a Kanto Kanrei (shogunal deputy for the Kanto region) in March, 1395.

sen.j: 同時に武蔵国の守護にも任じられた。
sen.e: At the same time, he was assigned to be shugo of Musashi Province.
At the same time, he was assigned to be shugo of Musashi Province.
At the same time, he was assigned to be shugo of Musashi Province.

sen.j: 1399年、応永の乱で大内義弘に共謀して鎌倉公方・足利満兼が呼応して挙兵しようとしたときはこれを諌めている。
sen.e: In 1399 during the Oei War when Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region), Mitsukane ASHIKAGA, tries to conspire raising an army along with Yoshihiro OUCHI, he remonstrates against this.

In 1399, when Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region), Mitsukane ASHIKAGA, planned to conspire with Yoshihiro OUCHI to raise an army in the Oei War, Tomomune remonstrated against his plan.

In 1399, when Kamakura kubo (governor-general of the Kanto region), Mitsukane ASHIKAGA, planned to conspire with Yoshihiro OUCHI to raise an army in the Oei War, Tomomune remonstrated against his plan.

sen.j: このため、満兼は出兵が大幅に遅れ、義弘は足利義満に討たれることとなったと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that due to this, Mitsukane was long delayed with sending his troops, and Yoshihiro was defeated by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
It is said that due to this, Mitsukane was long delayed with sending his troops, and Yoshihiro was defeated by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.
It is said that due to this, Mitsukane was long delayed with sending his troops, and Yoshihiro was defeated by Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 1405年9月、管領職を辞任する。
sen.e: He resignates the Kanryo shoku (a post of chief advisor) in 1405, September.
He resigned the Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) in September, 1405.
sen.cmt: resignates をresignedに変更、in 1405, Septemberをin September, 1405に変更
sen.e: He resigned the Kanryo shoku (a post of Chief Adviser) in September, 1405.

sen.j: 1409年、満兼の死を契機に剃髪して禅助と号し、上総に隠退する。
sen.e: In 1409, with the death of Mitsukane, he becomes a monk named Zenjo and withdrew to Kazusa.
In 1409, with the death of Mitsukane, he becomes a monk named Zenjo and withdrew to Kazusa.
In 1409, with the death of Mitsukane, he becomes a monk named Zenjo and withdrew to Kazusa.

sen.j: 家督も子の上杉禅秀（禅秀）に譲った。
sen.e: He gave the family estate to his son, Zensho UESUGI.
He gave the family estate to his son, Zenshu UESUGI.
He gave the family estate to his son, Zenshu UESUGI.

sen.j: 応永21年（1414年）8月25日死去。
sen.e: Died in 1414, August 25.
He died on August 25, 1414.
He died on August 25, 1414.

sen.j: 享年81。
sen.e: Age of death, 81.
His age at death was 81.
His age at death was 81.

sen.j: 法号は徳泉寺道元禅助。
sen.e: Hogo (a Buddhist name) is Tokusen-ji Temple Dogen Zenjo.
His hogo (a Buddhist name) is 徳泉寺道元禅助 (Tokusen-ji Temple Dogen Zenjo).
sen.cmt: 「徳泉寺道元禅助」を追加（補足）
sen.e: His hogo (a Buddhist name) is 徳泉寺道元禅助 (Tokusen-ji Temple Dogen Zenjo).

sen.j: 墓所は上総国長柄郡長柄山（現・千葉県長生郡長柄町長柄山）の眼蔵寺。
sen.e: Graveyard is located at Genzo-ji Temple in Nagara-yama, Nagara-gun, Kazusa Province (present Nagara-yama, Nagara-cho, Chosei District, Chiba Prefecture).
His graveyard is located at Genzo-ji Temple in Nagara-yama, Nagara-gun, Kazusa Province (present Nagara-yama, Nagara-cho, Chosei District, Chiba Prefecture).
His graveyard is located at Genzo-ji Temple in Nagara-yama, Nagara-gun, Kazusa Province (present Nagara-yama, Nagara-cho, Chosei District, Chiba Prefecture).

sen.j: 生年には異説が多く、父死後の1339年出生とも言われている。
sen.e: There are many different stories regarding his birth, and some say that he was born after the death of his father in 1339.
There are many different stories regarding his birth, and some say that he was born in 1339 after the death of his father.
There are many different stories regarding his birth, and some say that he was born in 1339 after the death of his father.
